description.narrative: By the end of 2018, at least 60% of pupils from public primary schools in target regions benefit from quality pedagogical supervision and develop life skills (including for HIV / AIDS prevention) (Old Formulation) By the end of 2016, at least 25% of pupils from public primary schools in the 7 target regions (Ziguinchor, Sedhiou, Kolda, Kedougou, Tambacounda, Matam, Dakar) benefit from quality pedagogical supervision and develop life skills (including for HIV / AIDS prevention)(Ancienne formulation) D'ici fin 2016, au moins 25% des Ã©lÃ¨ves des Ã©coles primaires publiques dans les 7 rÃ©gions d'intervention (Ziguinchor, Sedhiou, Kolda, Kedougou, Tambacounda, Matam, Dakar) bÃ©nÃ©ficient d'un encadrement pÃ©dagogique de qualitÃ© et dÃ©veloppent des compÃ©tences de vies courantes (dont la prÃ©vention VIH/sida), which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, at least 80 per cent of school-aged children, especially the most vulnerable, have access to quality basic education.

description.narrative: Teacher training and system strengthening interventions supported by UNICEF in 2018 have contributed to improve the quality of education and to align the new Education Sector Plan (PAQUET 2018-2030) with SDG targets, leading to a stronger focus on equity, skills and learning outcomes throughout and beyond the basic education cycle. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/02/2019
